::: learn
**On this page,** you will research and discuss
interactions between robots and humans.
:::

::: {#first .forYouToDo}
<ol>

<li>

Do one or more of these activities and share your findings:

<ol>

<li>

Research different ways that robots are modeled after animals 
and what the robots are used for. 

</li>

<li>

Many robots are being developed to be used to respond to disasters, such
as to search for and rescue people or to clean up radioactive sites.
Research recent developments and continuing challenges in this area of
robotics.


</li>

<li>

Robots have also changed the field of medicine. Research some of these
innovations and consider how the technology is changing lives.


</li>

<li>The use of industrial robots has eliminated some jobs for people,
especially in car factories. Research recent developments about
automation.</li>

</ol>

</li>

</ol>
:::

<img src="/img/atwork/Marina_Bers.JPG" title="photo of Marina Bers" alt="photo of Marina Bers" class="noshadow" height="200px"/>


Marina Bers is known for her work on computational thinking,
technology, and tools for children to learn computer programming. After
receiving her undergraduate degree from Buenos Aires University in
Argentina, she went on to earn a PhD from the MIT Media Laboratory in
2001, was a professor at Tufts University for 21 years and joined Boston
College in 2022. <br><br> Dr. Bers co-developed ScratchJr, an app which
teaches programming to children as young as age 5. Dr. Bers is also a
co-founder of KinderLab Robotics, where she developed KIBO, a robot that
young children can program with wooden blocks. Check out
<a href="https://www.scratchjr.org/" title="ScratchJr Website" target="_blank">ScratchJr</a>
and
<a href="https://kinderlabrobotics.com/kibo/" title="Kobo Website" target="_blank">Kobo</a>.
:::
